monq.stuff

Class ReaderFeeder

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.stuff.AbstractPipe
      • monq.stuff.ReaderFeeder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Service, Drainer, Feeder

    public class ReaderFeeder
extends AbstractPipe

    implements a Feeder that feeds data read from a Reader to the output specified by setOut().

    Objects of this class can be reused within a single thread.

    Author:
    © 2005 Harald Kirsch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReaderFeeder(java.io.Reader source, java.lang.String csname, int bsize)
      creates the Feeder to feed in to an OutputStream while encoding characters with the character set given by csname.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setOut(java.io.OutputStream out, boolean closeOnExit)
      specifies the OutputStream where to deliver the data in the run() method.
      void setSource(java.io.Reader in)
      specifies the source java.lang.Reader from which to fetch the data to feed.

      • Methods inherited from class monq.stuff.AbstractPipe

        getException, run, setIn

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReaderFeeder

        public ReaderFeeder(java.io.Reader source,
                    java.lang.String csname,
                    int bsize)
             throws java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException

        creates the Feeder to feed in to an OutputStream while encoding characters with the character set given by csname.

        Parameters:
        source - is the Reader from which to read input data. May be null, but then it must be set with setSource() before using this object.
        bsize - specifies the size of the internal character buffer and must be greater zero
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException

    • Method Detail

      • setSource

        public void setSource(java.io.Reader in)

        specifies the source java.lang.Reader from which to fetch the data to feed.

        Hint: Do not use the inherited method setIn(). If you need a Feeder with an InputStream as the source, use Pipe.

      • setOut

        public void setOut(java.io.OutputStream out,
                   boolean closeOnExit)
        Description copied from interface: Feeder

        specifies the OutputStream where to deliver the data in the run() method.

        Specified by:
        setOut in interface Feeder
        Overrides:
        setOut in class AbstractPipe
        closeOnExit - if true, instructs the Feeder to close out before exiting run().
